page.title: 14Houses in Haltwhistle
page.content: The oldest houses in Haltwhistle are around the Market Square and Castle Hill. They are built of local stone and most are privately owned. At the west end of town there are a lot of terraced houses, both stone and brick built. Bricks used to be made locally at Bardon Mill until the supply of local clay was used up. The Council have just completed a new estate which is surrounded by shrubs and trees. Older council houses nearer the centre of town are being renovated. There are some two and three storey blocks of flats. Old people throughout the district retire to sheltered accommodation in the town. There are two homes for elderly people but many choose to live in one of the flats or bungalows which have resident wardens to help them. There are about 2000 houses in all.
